config.name: Media Element Js
config.author: Arelowo Alao
config.description: Instead of offering an HTML5 player to modern browsers and a totally separate Flash player to older browsers, MediaElement.js upgrades them with custom Flash and Silverlight plugins that mimic the HTML5 MediaElement API. Magic happens, and then IE6-8 supports video and audio, Firefox and Opera support h.264, and Safari and IE9 support WebM (*if Adobe makes good on promises to support VP8 in Flash). Note that this player use jquery. You will need to have a template that does not have Mootools or figure out a way to deactivate it.
